org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.util

Class ByteArrayManager.FixedLengthManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.util.ByteArrayManager.FixedLengthManager
  • Enclosing class:
    ByteArrayManager

    static class ByteArrayManager.FixedLengthManager
extends Object
    Manage byte arrays with the same fixed length.

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        byte[] allocate()
          throws InterruptedException
        Allocate a byte array. If the number of allocated arrays >= maximum, the current thread is blocked until the number of allocated arrays drops to below the maximum. The byte array allocated by this method must be returned for recycling via the recycle(byte[]) method.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • recycle

        int recycle(byte[] array)
        Recycle the given byte array, which must have the same length as the array length managed by this object. The byte array may or may not be allocated by the allocate() method.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
